text: OSLO, May 12 The Norwegian mainland economy contracted more than expected in the first quarter of 2021 as a renewed lockdown to fight the pandemic hit activity.First-quarter mainland GDP, a measure which excludes oil and gas production, declined 1.0% compared with the October-December period, Statistics Norway said. A Reuters poll of 10 analysts had predicted a decline of 0.7%. (Reporting by Terje Solsvik; editing by Victoria Klesty and Andrew Heavens)
